sect2.title: Introduction to a2ps
sect2.para: a2ps is a filter utilitized mainly in the background and primarily by printing scripts to convert almost every input format into PostScript output. The application's name expands appropriately to "all to PostScript".

sect2.title: Installation of a2ps
sect2.para: Install a2ps by running the following commands:

userinput.command: sed -i -e "s|emacs||" contrib/Makefile.in && sed -i -e "s|/usr/local/share|/usr/share|" configure && sed -i -e "s|char \*malloc ();|/* & */|" \ lib/path-concat.c && ./configure --prefix=/usr \ --sysconfdir=/etc/a2ps --localstatedir=/var \ --enable-shared --with-medium=letter && make && make install

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: sed -i -e "s|emacs||" contrib/Makefile.in: This command eliminates the compiling and installing of the Emacs script files. If you have substituted Emacs for Vi as your primary editor, skip this step.
sed -i -e "s|/usr/local/share|/usr/share|" configure: This command modifies the configure script to search for Ghostscript fonts at the location where they were installed by the BLFS instructions.
sed -i -e "s|char \*malloc ();|/* & */|" lib/path-concat.c: This command fixes a build problem with GCC-3.4.x
--sysconfdir=/etc/a2ps: Configuration data is installed in /etc/a2ps instead of /usr/etc.
--enable-shared: This switch enables building the dynamic liba2ps library.
--with-medium=letter: This switch changes the default paper format of A4 to letter. Installations that utilize A4 would eliminate this switch.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: Information about configuring a2ps can be found in the comments contained in the above files, and also by running info a2ps.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The a2ps package contains a2ps, card, composeglyphs, fixnt, fixps, ogonkify, pdiff, psmandup, psset, texi2dvi4a2ps, liba2ps libraries and filter data.

sect3.title: a2ps
sect3.para: a2ps is a filter, utilized primarily by printing scripts, that converts standard input or supported files to PostScript.

sect3.title: card
sect3.para: card prints a reference card of a given program's options.

sect3.title: composeglyphs
sect3.para: composeglyphs creates a composite font program.

sect3.title: fixnt
sect3.para: fixnt is supposed to fix the problems in the PostScript files generated by the Microsoft PostScript driver under Windows NT (3.5 and 4.0).

sect3.title: fixps
sect3.para: fixps tries to fix common PostScript problems that break postprocessing.

sect3.title: ogonkify
sect3.para: ogonkify provides international support for Postscript by performing various munging of PostScript files related to printing in different languages.

sect3.title: pdiff
sect3.para: pdiff produces a pretty comparison between files.

sect3.title: psmandup
sect3.para: psmandup tries to produce a version of a given PostScript file to print in manual duplex.

sect3.title: psset
sect3.para: psset produces a version of a given PostScript file with a protected call to the PostScript operator 'setpagedevice'. Typical use is making a file print duplex, or on the manual tray, etc.

sect3.title: texi2dvi4a2ps
sect3.para: texi2dvi4a2ps compiles Texinfo and LaTeX files to DVI or PDF
